answers.answer: What are the reference ranges for the FT3, FT4 and prolactin?  Ranges vary from lab to lab and have to come from your own lab reports.Do you mean that your doctor diagnosed you with Polycystic Ovary Syndrome?You should talk to your doctor about the stomach pain; she may want you to discontinue the medication.PCOS is often treated with a medication called metformin, which is also used to treat type II diabetes, since the 2 are related.  PCOS can also, often be treated with diet and exercise alone.You should ask for thyroid antibody tests to determine if you have an autoimmune thyroid disease... you could have either Graves Disease or Hashimoto's Thyroiditis.  Graves Disease is always associated with hyperthyroidism.  Hashimoto's is usually associated with hypothyroidism, but is often characterized by periods of hyperthyroidism in the early stages.The antibody tests you need are Thyroid Peroxidase Antibodies (TPOab) and Thyroglobulin Antibodies (TgAb) to confirm/rule out Hashimoto's.  Thyroid Stimulating Immunoglobulin (TSI) is the definitive test for Graves Disease.

question: pls help mei m not getting my regular periods properlyin jan,feb,march,april i was getting on proper dates but with low bleeing..like first day 2-3 drops and then 4th dat 2-3 drops then thats it..then after april i did not get my periodsso now in june i went to a doctor she did my ultra sound and found that i hav B/L PCOshe checked my TSH... it is very low 0.05 uIU/mlprolactin is normal 13.37 ng/mltestoreone is normal 1.075 pg/mlas my TSH is very low she asked me to check ft3 and FT4and the reports areFT3 5.16 pmol/lFT4 21.81 pmol/l..and another thing...doctor gave me duphaston(10mg) to make my periods regularshe told me to take it twice daily for 7 days...and since 3-4 days im having a very bad stomach ache i hope it is not because of this medicineand about me.. im a juz 18 and studying...plz recommand me something which can help meand will this medicine help me?
title: plz help me with my reports
